title: I wanna say somethin
body:
You play ranked to get more LP, so you'll get in a higher division. To get LP, you'll have to win. But in order to win you can't lose obviously... So why should you ever surrender in ranked? A surrender is a 100% lose. If you just keep playing, there are still chances to win by luck, throw of the enemy, late game, objectives such as baron and towers Ect.
DON'T SURRENDER IN RANKEDï»¿

replies.body: While I never surrender, I know why people do it. They dont want to waste time on a game they see as already lost, and try and win the next one sooner.

Then their thinking is the problem.

No game is ever loss till the nexus explodes.
Some people don't want to put the effort into a game that has a much higher chance being a loss over a win so they surrender to end the game quicker and move on.
How will you learn to turn a losing game into a win, if you don't put the effort, test and learn during those losing game.

> [{quoted}](name=Skyprus,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=K92FruW8,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-04-02T05:05:51.165+0000)
>
> How will you learn to turn a losing game into a win, if you don't put the effort, test and learn during those losing game.

Turning a losing game into a win takes a lot more effort than winning a standard game. People don't want to put in that much effort, therefore they surrender and try for an easier game.

I don't recommend lower Elos to surrender as soon as something goes wrong, they should take the time and learn how to come back. In higher Elo it's a lot (I mean A LOT) harder to come back into a game, though still possible. If I've offended anyone by separating higher and lower Elos I apologise.

No you are quite right, I still remember in Preseason that no matter how many games I played half of them seemed to go to 50+ minutes, and quite often we would win even though we were behind early game. I actually rose then and made my way out of bronze but sadly it was preseason and I can't seem to do it now (drag too powerful i guess)

"Up until the defeat appears, the team is actually winning" - Scarra

Probably said it wrong.
I don't even surrender in Normals, bro.
Because high elo ranked matches are fixed. One team will let the other team push to win by 10 minutes for quick LP.

Some people just don't have the energy to deal with a stressful environment that they may be put in from this kind of thing, you shouldn't hold it against them unless of course they are being an asshat, but then you probably don't want to be in their game either if they are. But I do understand where you're coming from and if you're team is being positive it can be possible, if your team is being negative though, you're quite likely doomed for a loss.
